intro: Pittosporum poueboense, commonly known as the Pouébo pittosporum, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The plant features dark green, leathery leaves and produces fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, spherical berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds. Pittosporum poueboense is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
